com.datasift.dropwizard.util
Class Primitives

java.lang.Object
  com.datasift.dropwizard.util.Primitives

public class Primitives
extends Object

Utilities for working with primitive types and reflection.

Terminology:

Non-reference primitive types (e.g. int, double, void) are considered native primitives, or sometimes, unboxed primitives.

Reference primitive types (e.g. Integer, Double, Void) are considered boxed primitives.

Conversion between native primitves and boxed primitives can be done with box(Class) and unbox(Class).

Whenever possible, boxing/unboxing will be implicit and transparent, with a preference for native primitive types.

Primitives

public Primitives()
Method Detail

box

public static Class box(Class clazz)
Produces the Class for the boxed counterpart of the given primitive Class.

Parameters:
clazz - the Class of the primitive type to get the boxed counterpart for.
Returns:
the Class of the boxed counterpart to the given primitive type Class or; if the argument is already a boxed primitive, the argument itself.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the given Class is not for a primitive type.

unbox

public static Class unbox(Class clazz)
Produces the Class for the native primitive counterpart of the given boxed primitive Class.

Parameters:
clazz - the Class of the boxed primitive type to unbox to a native primitive.
Returns:
the Class of the native primitive counterpart to the given boxed primitive Class or; if the argument is already a native primitive, the argument itself.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the given Class is not for a primitive type.

isAssignableFrom

public static boolean isAssignableFrom(Class target,
                                       Class source)
Determines whether the objects of the given source Class can be assigned to the primitive type of the given target Class.

If either type is a boxed-primitive, it will be unboxed automatically; all comparisons will be of the native primitive types.

Parameters:
target - the Class of the type you wish to assign to.
source - the Class of the type you wish to assign from.
Returns:
true if objects of the source Class can be assigned to the type of the target Class; otherwise, false.

isPrimitive

public static boolean isPrimitive(Class clazz)
Determines whether the given Class is for a primitive type; either native or boxed.

Both boxed and native primitive types are considered "primitives". Example: Primitives.isPrimitive(int.class) == true; Primitives.isPrimitive(Integer.class) == true; Primitives.isPrimitive(String.class) == false;

Parameters:
clazz - the Class of the type to determine whether or not it is for a primitive type.
Returns:
true if the given Class is for a primitive type, boxed or native; false if the given Class is for any other type.

isBoxedPrimitive

public static boolean isBoxedPrimitive(Class clazz)
Determines whether the given Class is for a boxed primitive type.

Only boxed primitive types are accepted. Example: Primitives.isPrimitive(int.class) == false; Primitives.isPrimitive(Integer.class) == true; Primitives.isPrimitive(String.class) == false;

Parameters:
clazz - the Class of the type to determine whether or not it is for a boxed primitive type.
Returns:
true if the given Class is for a boxed primitive type; false if the given Class is for any other type, including native primitive types.

isNativePrimitive

public static boolean isNativePrimitive(Class clazz)
Determines whether the given Class is for a native primitive type.

Only native primitive types are accepted. Example: Primitives.isPrimitive(int.class) == true; Primitives.isPrimitive(Integer.class) == false; Primitives.isPrimitive(String.class) == false;

Parameters:
clazz - the Class of the type to determine whether or not it is for a native primitive type.
Returns:
true if the given Class is for a native primitive type; false if the given Class is for any other type, including boxed primitive types.

requirePrimitiveClass

public static Class requirePrimitiveClass(Class clazz)
Asserts that the given Class is for a primitive type, either native or boxed.

Parameters:
clazz - the Class to assert is for a primitive type.
Returns:
the given Class, without modifications, to facilitate chaining.
Throws:
AssertionError - if the given Class is for a non-primitive type.
